headline: VELVEETA Down-Home Macaroni and Cheese
description: Use Velveeta in this mac and cheese recipe for the perfect balance of cheesy and creamy elbow pasta in Velveeta sauce with a buttery cracker topping.
name: VELVEETA Down-Home Macaroni and Cheese
recipeIngredient: 2 cups elbow macaroni, cooked and drained

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 2-quart casserole dish with cooking spray.
Melt 3 tablespoons butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in flour; cook and stir for 2 minutes.
Gradually stir in milk and bring to boil; cook and stir until thickened, 3 to 5 minutes.
Add Velveeta; cook and stir until melted, about 3 minutes. Stir in cooked macaroni.
Spoon mixture into the prepared dish; sprinkle with Cheddar cheese. Mix melted butter and cracker crumbs until combined; sprinkle over casserole.
Bake in the preheated oven until heated through, about 20 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I didn't use all of the butter and would use half the cheddar cheese next time. Used lightly toasted bread cubed instead of crumbs, and added salt and pepper. Will make again.

Excellent recipe for home made macaroni and cheese. Easy enough for a beginner cook to succeed. It is very cheesy but not too much. I added 1/4 more milk as it was too thick. Also it the melted butter down to 2 tablespoons instead of 5 for the cracker top crumbs. Delicious!
I cut the recipe in half. Otherwise prepared as written. Very good!

I didn't have any cheddar cheese so I used strips of Velveeta on top and when it was finished cooking I put it under the broiler for several minutes. Also mixed in crumbled Italian Sausage instead of bacon. Served it with a green salad. Nice dinner meal

I made it exactly as written. I usually don't use Velveeta in mac n cheese. I don't make a lot of mac n cheese for that matter but my husband & mother in law love it. My husband said it was just okay and my mother in law said basically the same as the other reviewers and I agree. It's ok/ good, not great. Too thick for me, needs more cheese/sauce, more flavor and I did put a sharp cheddar on top. When I make up my own concoctions, I use a few different cheeses and no flour. Anyway, if you make this, you may want to have some of your own twists to make this really good. When I reheat this as leftovers it will need some doctoring.
It was yummy. My great granddaughter age 2 didn't try it. Her mac and cheese has to come from a box.
This recipe was pretty easy for "old school" mac & cheese.
First time using velveta cheese. Turned out delicious. I do add sliced olives and cut up tomato in my Mac and cheese. Still delicious.
Added a pound of bacon and as for the Ritz, had to go ahead and use close to a whole clip of em, yum

This recipe is terrible. Made as instructed. Extremely bland tasting (absolutely barely tastes like cheese) and in my opinion it was creamy and perfect BEFORE putting in the oven. IF I ever made this again I would increase the cheese taste somehow and STOP after combining in the pan. The oven just dried everything out and is a completely stupid step (unless you like really tacky and dry Mac and cheese).

Works with almond milk, even if you don’t even have enough it. We didn’t properly check if we had everything we needed before we started making it and found we only had half the almond milk we needed. We just needed to add a *tiny* bit of water to replace what burned off. I don’t know if it works with fake cheese.

Perfect as is. This is my go to for making homemade mac and cheese. I have 6 kids aged 10-18 and they love it. I double the recipe to make a 9x13 pan. I use a dry box of elbow noodles (1 pound box or 4 cups uncooked noodles) since the recipe states “cooked” noodles). Everything is doubled and I use the recipe exactly how it’s written. It’s perfect!
I used one cup of half and half cream instead of milk. Also topped it with buttered Italian bread crumbs and Triple Cheddar Cheese pkg. One cup.
Great recipe and it was a hit at a family party. Being a Wisconsin girl I’m wondering if I can add some sour cream to mix it up a bit…..Otherwise this was a great recipe
It was the best mac and cheese I've ever had my niece ate it no problem definitely making for my nephews the next time they come!! So good
Love this just as is!!
My husband said that I have to make this Mac n Cheese all the time. It was so good. I used microwaveable bacon. Best baked Mac n cheese yet!
I made this just as directed except instead of putting crackers on the top I used French’s dried onions. We loved it and I am making it for a Christmas party because I know it will be a hit!

this is the perfect combination of cheesy and creamy. I used half and half instead of milk, put cooked bacon in it before baking it, used whole wheat macaroni. and use bread crumbs instead of Ritz crackers, but I will definitely use this recipe again!

I made this in preparation for a bridal shower and I cooked it in muffin tins for 25 minutes at 350. I picked this recipe because it had velveeta like my mother in law’s recipe but way less margarine and shredded cheese. I also picked it because it had flour which I guessed I needed to hold up in a muffin for a party. It certainly was stiff and would look good at a party. But it was very plain tasting and dry and that was right after coming out of the oven. I would guess that using less flour and more milk would help this recipe.

I made this in preparation for a bridal shower and I cooked it in muffin tins for 25 minutes at 350. I picked this recipe because it had velveeta like my mother in law’s recipe but way less margarine and shredded cheese. I also picked it because it had flour which I guessed I needed to hold up in a muffin for a party. It certainly was stiff and would look good at a party. But it was very plain tasting and dry and that was right after coming out of the oven. I would guess that using less flour and more milk would help this recipe.

This was very tasty. I tried it because normally I don't use Velveeta, but my dad brought some over and I wanted to use it. I will definitely make it again. I did double the amount of noodles and it was perfect. I also added spices, like Tapatio and chili powder, simply because we like it spicy.
OMG!!! Absolutely delicious!!! If I didn’t have such a small stomach, I’d love to eat the batch.
Great recipes--total comfort food. Next time, will reduce the thickening--it was a little sticky when done--I'll go for a bit more creamy next time.
Easy and good! I used Asiago along with the sharp cheddar. Delicious!

Fantastic starter/ base recipe. I had to use 5 TB of butter, might even could've used 6 to smooth out the roux, but once I got it going and added the milk it started thickening up really quick. If you are new to cooking, have ALL of your ingredients ready before you start this sauce. I am an experienced cook and this sauce came up real quick. Had to add a little more milk after the velveeta to smooth it out. Like others added some onion powder, garlic powder, salt/ pepper. I used plain breadcrumbs instead of crackers (2Tb to 2/3 c roughly). But over all, fantastic base recipe.

I added a dash of onion powder and dash of dry mustard. and for the half cup of other cheese, I used colbey jack cause that's all I had. Did not do the crackers cause I was short on time but may use panko bread crumbs for future. My brother and family loved it!!
This was delicious, doubled the recipe, added a little onion powder and shredded cheddar to the sauce and added chopped sliced ham and peas before baking. Super good!

Very nice. I added 1/2 cup swiss cheese and took a little of the Velvita out. This is so much better than the new recipe they have on the back of the Velvita box. The other newer recipe is basically no better than Kraft Mac and Cheese. This one is real Mac and Cheese.
My new mac and cheese recipe! Only omitted crackers. Creamy roux sauce.
Nice and cheesey but used panko crumbs since I had no crackers
I used 1/2 and 1/2 instead of milk and added 1 cup of cubed ham. did find that I had to thin the mix with a bit of milk before adding the macaroni in.
Super easy (for coronavirus shut-in season) but not super flavorful as written.

Delicious!! Velveeta makes it so yummy!!! 
Easy to make and hubby loved it!

I've stayed away from processed cheese for a long time and I had forgotten how good (and melty) Velveeta can be. This recipe is mac and cheese that fits my best expectation for cheddar flavor and texture. I used Velveeta Sharp Cheddar and added extra sharp cheddar to the sauce. . There is plenty of sauce and next time I will use the whole box of medium shells. THANKS!

This was EXCELLENT!! Like others, I added about an extra 1/4 cup of milk to make it creamier. I also added chunks of breaded lobster. I let it sit for 2 hours then nuked for 2 minutes then in the oven at 375* with the extra shredded cheese and ritz cracker for 20 minutes. 
Absolutely mouthwatering deeeelish!
Yum!
Loved this recipe! A big hit in my house and i will definitely be making this again
I have made this several times, and my whole family loves it. Thank you for saving us from boxed mac-n-cheese!
It was ok, first few bites were good when it was right out of oven, when it started to cool down a little it was kind of gross and thick/clumpy, followed recipe exactly won’t make again
Okay, but bland. Won’t make it again.
I put parmesan cheese powder on top with more real bacon bits, before putting in oven.

I only made this because I needed to use up some Velveeta cheese and I have to say it was way too dry. I thought this as I was preparing and almost added more milk, but wanted to make it as the recipe called for. For anyone else wanting to try this recipe, I would add another cup of milk and maybe some real cheddar cheese to add more flavor. I did like the topping though.
I did some compassion do to fur children being faster than me but it came out well

I made a double recipe to fill a 9' x 13" pottery baking dish. I don't usually bother to bake my mac and cheese but made this for my father's 82nd birthday party and followed the recipe as written (except for doubling the recipe and baking it a little bit longer - 30 minutes). The crispy cracker crumbs on top were super yummy!
Added a few shakes of Franks Hot Sauce into the cheese sauce before adding the macaroni. Instead of ritz crackers I used Pablo bread crumbs on top.
awesome!! did NOT have townhouse crackers, so opted for Italian Bread Crumbs. Yummy!!

This was Just delicious...Very creamy and cheesy as well! I would make this again!
I did do a bit more than 2 cups of pasta because the cheese sauce is very generous... and I added a bit more milk so it wasn’t so thick. This is def a mac n cheese kids will love!
I Made this exactly as listed and Omg it is Phenomenal. Thank you soooo much :)
No, I did not make any changes. Everyone already asking for it again. Great!

It was ok. But it needs some seasoning. I made exactly like the recipe. But ended up sprinkling salt and pepper. Maybe some paprika would be good too. The bacon bits would probably be a good addition.
Added crushed croutons for the seasoning!
Delicious! My daughter who “doesn’t like Mac n cheese” ate every bite! I added ground turkey and garlic powder with bread crumbs instead of Ritz crackers on top.

The only change I made to the recipe was to increase measurements for a bigger batch. Turned out fantastic. Added bacon but was thinking kielbasa sausage would work well too. Definitely plan to make again.

I used leek sautéed with Vietnamese spicy chili garlic sauce. Used Country Crock plant butter instead made with avocado oil, and it turned out fine. I had some Sargento reduced fat cheese sticks to use up. Didn’t like them straight out of the package but the cheddar ones were great on top, just that as a topping it was more curds in place than shredded evenness. Used extra sharp cheddar Velveeta in the bechemel. Would love to make this again. This is a fantastic recipe. The macaroni and cheese was gooey, but not too gooey, creamy but not too creamy, packed with flavor. Pro tip: remember to take your pan toasted cracker crumbs off heat and don’t taste them straight off the pan. Burned my tongue.
I added some leftover roasted ham and a can of Rotel, with the liquid, to make the sauce creamier and include some vegetable flavors. I'll make it again.
No changes! The first time you make a new recipe, do it the way they say to do! Then one can adjust to their taste preferences.
This was so easy to make and very delicious. My very picky 10 year old had three helpings so this is definitely a keeper!
Added beef sausage and mozzarella cheese on top

I doubled the recipe and I am glad I did because it was a hit! I followed everyones advise and reduced the flour and used more milk. For the doubled recipe I used 6 tsps of butter, 1/4 flour, 2 1/2 cups of milk, 4 cups of pasta, 12 oz of velveeta packets, a little salt, pepper, seasoning salt and about 1 cup of shredded cheddar and 1/2 cup of shredded mexican blend cheese. I toped with crackers and baked 25 minutes on 350. Perfect!
no changes, very creamy the best mac & cheese
Ive made it twice.. Everyone loves it... Will make again.
Best scalloped potatoes I've had. A lot like my mom's.
I made it according to recipe, and although it was cheesy and creamy, it tasted just like the Velveeta boxed Mac and cheese, not homemade. Just alittle disappointed
Pretty good as is. I'm giving 4 stars because I'd double the ritz cracker topping. I also added more milk because the cheese sauce was thicker than I liked. Will make again.
one of our favorites. When i'm in a hurry i serve it up without baking it and omit the crumbs
Super simple, crazy cheesy and ready in no time

Giving it 4 stars as written because I followed naples' review and whisked a large spoonful of white cheddar into the milk to amp up the sharpness.I used whole milk, no flour. Finished with a cup of buttered fresh breadcrumbs.

*I added the shredded cheese(shredded Mexican-its what i had) to the Velveeta mix along with 1/4 cup of Alfredo sauce(leftover in my fridge).
*I added pink salt, pepper, garlic powder and dried oregano to cheese mix... about 1 tsp of each.
*after spraying the pan i sprinkled Parmesan cheese on the bottom of the pan
*I used garlic bread crumbs instead of RITZ crackers
I have made this recipe several times as requested by my family. I double the recipe as the boys want leftovers to take for lunch. Recommend totally
Used a little less flour, more milk and added freeze dried chives for exceptional flavor.
My kids loved this Mac-n-cheese. That is really the only thing they wanted to eat of the Christmas dinner!
I added Ham to it it smells yummy
I used cheese-its instead of Ritz crackers

Made this for my family Thanksgiving. I doubled the recipe and put it all in a 9x13 pyrex baking dish no problem. I also used shells instead of elbow macaroni. Kids came to the adult table to ask for it back after we took it. Definitely something to make again.

Love this! super easy! I added pepper to taste. I also added Slap ya mama seasoning to Panko crumbs and crumbled that on top before baking! I also did min in a 13x9 which was fine I just kept an eye on it while it was in the oven!
After reading several reviews, I skipped the flour part and added more cheese to the sauce. Omg, it’s good!

I only added about half
 the flour and I used another reviewer's recommendation of putting butter on the bottom of the pan that's sprinkled parmesan cheese on top. I added salt pepper onion powder and garlic powder. I use bread crumbs mixed with parsley for the topping. Delicious!

I added mustard seasoning peper garlic salt and baked with parmasaon cheese and sharp cheddar on top and breading crumbs on top

I slow cooked pork on low for a lil over 5 hours. Sweet bbq sauce instead and beef bulion cube instead and not brown suger but regular sugar pepper and a little bit if salt

I had to triple the recipe for a potluck Boy Scout function. I overlooked the noodles. Blech -- too mushy. The taste was a little bit bland for me. I may try adding some of the suggested spices like dry mustard or perhaps Dijon mustard. I used crushed garlic flavored crackers on top. That really helped boost the flavor. I will likley make it again and experiment.
I made with no changes !! It turned out JUST RIGHT !! I will be making it AGAIN!

Loved this recipe! I guess maybe I'm one of those traditionalists who likes a basic but delicious Mac and cheese without a bunch of unnecessary ingredients. I followed the instructions with the following deviations:. 1-i skipped the flour and am glad I did. It was plenty thick without it. 2-I added an extra 1/4 cup of milk to get the creamy sauce I prefer.3-i added a handful of shredded sharp white cheddar cheese to the sauce mix.4-I used 1/2 cup panko breadcrumbs mixed with 2 tbsp of melted butter for the topping and it crisped up perfectly. I will absolutely make this again. In fact I can't wait to!
Followed the recipe exactly and thought it was just a fair dish. It had very little flavor. It was easy to prepare.
I made an extra thicc sauce
I added a few more Ritz crackers to the butter and also a few dry crumbs on top. This dish was absolutely delicious! Will make again and again.
No more boxed macaroni and cheese for my family . This was easy and tasty. I changed one thin instead of shredded cheese I used Campbell’s can cheddar nice and creamy!
Great Mac, but definitely add salt and pepper or seasoning of your choice because it was kinda bland.

This was a big hit at our Super Bowl party this year, along with pulled pork sandwiches. I used cheddar cheese as well, as suggested by another reviewer, and it turned out creamy and tasty. Will definitely use this recipe again!
Wish I had read the reviews first. This recipe has way to much flour in it. I want mac and cheese, not paste.
It's pretty basic. Don't know if I'll make again or not.

I loved it with a few tweaks. Doubled recipe but used 1/2 of the flour in the original recipe and 5 cups of milk. Also added salt, pepper, paprika and ground mustard. About 1tbs of each except for the salt. Just sprinkled it on top. Also I put it back in the oven under the broiler to crust the top after baking. About 5 min. I used cracker and jalapeno fried onions topper. Cooked in a 9 x 13 casserole dish. Perfectly creamy. Amount of milk may seem excessive but trust me, if you like a creamy Mac and cheese you need it. I might use even more next time!
So easy & delicious

Yum!!!! My girls and hubby devoured this entire pan! I used freshly grated sharp cheddar and doubled the cheese by adding half a cup to the sauce and the second half cup on the top. I added salt, pepper, garlic powder and ground mustard to the sauce as well. I broiled it for a minute or two when it was finished baking. This was a hit that we will have again for sure. :)
Love this recipie. I thought it could have been a tad bit creamier but it was hit so nothing to fix.
Just add a little more cheese ... amazing
My daughter makes this frequently and I decided to try it this past weekend. I followed the recipe exactly and it was delicious and easy to make! Love it!
New family fav
Will be making it again and again. Probably will add more cracker crumb topping. Used vegetable crackers and it was delicious.

This is a good basic recipe. I read the reviews and added more milk and less flour and it worked out perfect. We also like a lot more flavor so I added salt and pepper and 2 pinches of cayenne pepper. Trust me, you will never know except to add a bit more flavor. I will for sure make this again.
